Instrument.name: A Star Tracker Camera for CLEM1
Instrument.description: The Clementine spacecraft featured dual star tracker cameras (A and B) mounted to ensure uninterrupted star field coverage. Their primary role was to determine spacecraft attitude using stellar images compared to an onboard catalog, with secondary scientific applications including observations of dim lunar surfaces and the solar corona. The cameras employed a Thomson focal plane array and had a wide field of view, capable of 13-bit programmable integration but limited to broad band imaging. They required calibration before launch and operated with three modes for integration time, gain, and offset. Specifications include a pixel format of 576x384, a readout rate of 5MHz, and the capability to capture images across wavelengths of 0.5 to 1.1 microns.
